meanings.definition: The quality or state of being drinkable or suitable for drinking.
meanings.sent1: The potabilities of the water in the stream were questionable.
meanings.sent2: The potabilities of the new juice blend were praised by the customers.
meanings.sent3: The party guests joked about the potabilities of the punch being too strong.
meanings.sent4: The potabilities of the tea were as clear as crystal to the tea connoisseur.
meanings.sent5: The potabilities of the soda were so high that everyone wanted a sip.

meanings.definition: The likelihood or possibility of being able to be realized or achieved.
meanings.sent1: The potabilities of winning the lottery are extremely low.
meanings.sent2: The potabilities of success in the project seemed promising.
meanings.sent3: The potabilities of finding a four-leaf clover in the garden are slim.
meanings.sent4: The potabilities of reaching the mountain peak were within their grasp.
meanings.sent5: The potabilities of a snow day excited the students beyond measure.
